description.summary: Small white bipedal creatures that appear to be legs only, with no visible body or arms. Known from two pieces of surveillance footage from California.
description.full: The Fresno Nightcrawlers are mysterious entities captured on surveillance video in Fresno, California (2007) and Yosemite (2011). The creatures appear as short, white or pale figures with long legs and no discernible torso, arms, or headâ€”giving them a distinctive 'walking pants' appearance. Standing 2-4 feet tall, they move with a wadding bipedal gait. While some claim connections to Native American folklore (specifically the Yokuts tribe), these claims are disputed. Most experts consider the videos to be hoaxes, likely created using stilts covered with white fabric, as this would be simple to fabricate. Despite high hoax probability, the Nightcrawlers have become an internet and paranormal TV phenomenon.

history.modern_era: The Fresno Nightcrawlers have become an internet meme and are frequently featured on paranormal television shows. Despite their popularity, only two pieces of video evidence exist, and skeptics consider them easily fabricated hoaxes.

notable.name: Fresno Security Footage
notable.description: Jose, a Fresno homeowner, captured footage on his home security camera showing two small, white, bipedal figures walking across his front lawn. The creatures appeared to be approximately 2-4 feet tall with no visible body above the legs, creating a 'walking pants' appearance. They moved with a distinctive wadding gait.

factors: Simple to fake with stilts and fabric
credibility.notes: Most experts consider this a hoax due to the ease of fabrication using stilts covered with white fabric.

notable.name: Yosemite Footage
notable.description: Second video footage emerged showing similar creatures in Yosemite National Park. The figures displayed the same characteristics as the Fresno footage: white coloration, bipedal movement, leg-only appearance.

credibility.notes: Likely copycat hoax following Fresno footage popularity.
